head.title: On Death Row, but by Mistake

hedline.hl1: On Death Row, but by Mistake

abstract.p: Paul L Whiteley Sr letter says evidence of serious flaws in administration of death penalty is good reason to do away with it altogether (S)

block.p: The just-released evidence showing serious flaws in this country's administration of the death penalty is good reason to do away with it forever (editorial, June 13). Even though a majority of Americans favor the death penalty, it is morally and spiritually wrong.
It is an act of vengeance that brings no real peace to the vengeful.

The just-released evidence showing serious flaws in this country's administration of the death penalty is good reason to do away with it forever (editorial, June 13). Even though a majority of Americans favor the death penalty, it is morally and spiritually wrong.
It is an act of vengeance that brings no real peace to the vengeful.

Life in prison without the possibility of parole should be the maximum punishment that error-prone humankind should be allowed to mete out to fellow brothers and sisters who commit capital crimes. It will be a grand day when the death penalty is abolished and the issue is taken out of the hands of politicians who want to appear tough on crime.
PAUL L. WHITELEY SR. Louisville, Ky., June 13, 2000
